poem:
Drill, Baby, Drill

Inside the chambers  
of power, deals  
like oil's dark flow  

gush forth—  
concrete promises  
to the smoky sky—  

while earth shivers  
beneath  
unsaid words—

a rigged whisper:  
the quiet dissent  
of lost seas  
and unheard winds.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Explained: how Trump’s day one orders reveal a White House for big oil Through a flurry of executive orders, a newly inaugurated Donald Trump has made clear his support for the ascendancy of fossil fuels, the dismantling of support for cleaner energy and the United States’ exit from the fight to contain the escalating climate crisis. “We will drill, baby, drill,” the president said in his inaugural address on Monday. “We have something that no". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
